intro: Matthiola hesperoides, commonly known as the coastal stock, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of California and Baja California. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, clustered flowers and pinnately lobed leaves. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in coastal climates with mild winters and warm, dry summers. It produces white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Matthiola hesperoides is often found in disturbed sites and is considered a rare, endemic species in its native range.
